name: Helen Keller International
mission: Guided by our founder’s remarkable legacy, Helen Keller Intl works to improve the lives of people around the world by protecting vision, enhancing nutri...
theoryOfChange: Helen Keller International utilizes the 'Essential Nutrition Actions (ENA) framework' as an organizing framework for its strategy to improve maternal, infant, and young child nutrition. This framework provides an operational approach for advocacy, planning, training, and delivery of an integrated package of interventions designed to achieve public health impact. Additionally, their broader organizational strategy, 'Leading Locally, Fortifying Futures,' outlines their approach to sustaining core program areas of nutrition, vision, and health, and driving transformation in high-impact areas. The organization also emphasizes 'Rigor' as a core value, combining research, evidence, and on-the-ground experience to achieve large-scale and long-term impact.

zakatClaimEvidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: http://helenkellerintl.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/FY23_HKI-Financial-Statements-FINAL.pdf)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 37/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: Helen Keller International shows strong alignment and good impact.

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: http://helenkellerintl.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/FY23_HKI-Financial-Statements-FINAL.pdf)

all_citations.claim: Helen Keller International holds a 99.5/100 score for financial health and accountability.
The organization reported a total revenue of $145,494,796.
The organization manages significant in-kind medicine distributions.
The charity maintains an 82.8% program expense ratio and distributes donated medicines globally.
The organization offers various donation options suitable for general charitable giving and sadaqah.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial transparency and alignment with urgent global health needs, though its impact score reflects the high costs associated with systemic healthcare reform.
areas_for_improvement: High cost per beneficiary for specific systemic change interventions
Complexity of scaling specialized medical programs across diverse international regulatory environments

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity is highly aligned with donors interested in global health and sadaqah-eligible giving, maintaining a long track record of accountability and high data confidence [1][8]. Its mission addresses urgent global needs, including the distribution of donated medicines and sight-saving surgeries [5][7].
dimension_explanations.impact: Helen Keller International maintains a program expense ratio of 82.8%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach its vision and nutrition programs [1][2]. While the organization focuses on systemic change, the cost per beneficiary is approximately $2,063.76, reflecting the intensive nature of its medical and nutritional interventions [7].

baseline_narrative.headline: Helen Keller International honors its founder’s legacy by combating the causes and consequences of blindness and malnutrition through evidence-based global health interventions.
strengths: Exceptional financial health with a Charity Navigator score of 99.5/100
High fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.03 to raise every $1
Robust liquidity with 18.6 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: founded in 1915, Helen Keller International works across Africa, Asia, and the United States to protect vision and enhance nutrition for vulnerable populations [1]. The organization reported a total revenue of $145,494,796, supporting large-scale programs such as the US Vision Program and international health care initiatives [2][7].
